El juego de naves Everspace 2 consigue financiarse en Kickstarter poco antes de que acabe su campaña
05 Nov 2019, 10:19 by Jonathan León
Everspace fue un título de naves en 3D que se estructuraba de una forma muy peculiar para su género: era un roguelike. Su secuela quiere convertirse en el golpe en la mesa que aquel juego no fue, y ahora parece que podrá serlo. 
Rockfish Games ha conseguido superar la campaña de Kickstarter para Everspace 2, y ha sido en el último momento. La cifra alcanzó los 450.000 dólares que pedían justo un día antes de acabar, como ellos mismos relatan en su comunicado.
Como Kickstarter ha cambiado tanto, sabemos que creer y confiar en nosotros es el mayor regalo que nos podéis hacer. En serio, nos ha fascinado vuestra pasión por nuestro ambicioso proyecto, especialmente durante los días en los que varias herramientas de predicción de crowdfunding indicaban que no lo íbamos a lograr, y eso empezó a salir también en los medios.



Gracias a esto, el juego podrá seguir adelante sin problemas. Además, como finalmente han recaudado 503.478 dólares en total, podrán incluir la primera stretch goal. Se trata de unos portales especiales que aparecerán al final del juego, y que nos llevarán a regiones llenas de desafíos del más alto nivel.
Everspace 2 será esta vez un mundo abierto persistente con muchos más recovecos que explorar, nada de generación procedimental. Sus creadores lo definen como un shooter looter pero con naves. Hay clases, mejoras, niveles, y montones de recompensas esperando a ser encontradas en los confines del espacio.
En Rockfish Games son también famosos por haber rechazado tajantemente la exclusividad con Epic Games Store, a sabiendas de que eso les iba a beneficiar económicamente. Como han dicho en varias ocasiones, la comunidad les ha suplicado quedarse en Steam, y eso harán.
text:
The Everspace 2 spacecraft game gets funded on Kickstarter shortly before the end of its campaign
05 Nov 2019, 10:19 by Jonathan León
Everspace was a 3D ship title that was structured in a very peculiar way for its genre: it was a roguelike. Its sequel wants to become the blow on the table that that game was not, and now it seems that it can be.
Rockfish Games has managed to overcome the Kickstarter campaign for Everspace 2, and it has been at the last moment. The figure reached the $ 450,000 they asked for just one day before finishing, as they themselves report in their statement.
As Kickstarter has changed so much, we know that believing and trusting us is the greatest gift you can give us. Seriously, we have been fascinated by your passion for our ambitious project, especially during the days when several crowdfunding prediction tools indicated that we were not going to achieve it, and that also began to appear in the media.



Thanks to this, the game can move on smoothly. In addition, as they have finally raised $ 503,478 in total, they may include the first stretch goal. These are special portals that will appear at the end of the game, and that will take us to regions full of challenges of the highest level.
Everspace 2 will be this time a persistent open world with many more recesses to explore, nothing procedural generation. Its creators define it as a shooter looter but with ships. There are classes, improvements, levels, and lots of rewards waiting to be found in the confines of space.
In Rockfish Games they are also famous for having categorically rejected exclusivity with the Epic Games Store, knowing that it would benefit them economically. As they have said on several occasions, the community has begged them to stay on Steam, and they will do that.
